intro: Xylotheca tettensis var. tettensis, commonly known as the Tett's xylotheca, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring dense, fibrous root systems and a compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky substrates or in sandy soils. Its leaves are typically small, waxy, and adapted to minimize water loss, while its flowers are small and clustered, often in shades of white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
